website_summaries.verdict: This top notch harness delivers superior control with 2 well placed loops and a double connection leash. Hands-down the best option for enthusiastic tuggers.
pros: Dual metal D rings positioned at the chest and between the shoulder blades deliver  unrivalled control
Conveniently comes with a double connection leash, allowing you to control your dog from both the back and the front simultaneously
Lightweight and comfortable with Swiss velvet lining to reduce chafing behind the legs
cons: Could be a little easier to put on
Leash isn't the longest, but works well for training

website_summaries.verdict: Offers both a chest loop and a back loop, so you can use the harness however you want.
pros: Harness ships with a Y-shaped leash, so you can walk the dog with two points of contact on the harness for a greater level of control and security
It's a Made in America product
Made from a heavy-duty nylon construction with stainless steel hardware for excellent quality
cons: Takes some practice to use the double connection leash well

customer_reviews.title: Great function, horrible quality.
customer_reviews.text: Was so excited to use a well reviewed control harness. It did work almost instantly. On our very first walk our 60 lb lab puppy showed huge improvement on his pulling. We have been using it each night and hes almost fully rid of his bad pulling habits. But after only 5 uses part of the webbing snapped in half.. not at sewing junction either, but right in a middle spot of the cheap webbing. I highly recommend looking into a no pull style harness, maybe just look for one from another manufacture.
customer_reviews.author: Frozenpeaz

customer_reviews.title: Worth a try for troubled walkers
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts about this harness but it works like a charm. I highly recommend it for your dog if he isn't a good walker. We have one dog who is a good walker and it just made him better. The dogs react to the squeeze around the middle better than the pull from most harnesses. My dog weighs 125 plus pounds and this helped me avoid a possible shoulder dislocation every time he see a .......squirrel, dog, cat, kid, bike, stroller, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Denise K. Montrose

customer_reviews.title: Not fun.  Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited about this no pull harness. Dog responded to it in the house, but on a walk...not at all. Dog pulled so much that I had to have a friend hold the leashes. He was so tired of the pulling that he hooked the leashes through his belt. I'm surprised my 62 pound Lab didn't drag him. She never stopped pulling at all. I think this no pull, means no pulling for the dogs, all pulling on people. Fit great, no rashes, no rubbing, nice material and construction, but if your dog has a strong prey drive, this will not work. I would have returned, but I'm a day too late with such a short return window.
customer_reviews.author: Diane L

customer_reviews.title: If I could give it more than 5 stars I would!
customer_reviews.text: I have an 85lb, 6yr old American bulldog. I’ve had him since he was 6 weeks old and from day 1 it was a battle of wills. Everything I’ve used and everything I tried failed. I put this harness on and he was a totally different dog IMMEDIATELY. I used the leash connected to the back and front, his head slides through it with no complications when changing direction. I’ve already ordered a 2nd one for his sister.
customer_reviews.author: Ripplesdiscoverys

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I'm really disappointed with this product. We spend more time on our walk trying to get the leash out from under him. Nova is a pitty mix and he's not really tall. He also pulls like crazy with his nose to the ground. He's constantly stepping over the part of the leash that attaches to the front. Then he gets tangled in it. It also does absolutely nothing in the way of stopping him from pulling.
customer_reviews.author: Berniek

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: Worth it's weight in gold !! I adopted a extremely strong pitbull, a choker had absolutely zero effect on her plus felt guilty about trying to choke her out. I read reviews about this harnesses before purchasing ,it was cosiderably more expensive than others. It has been nothing short of a miracle! ! She does absolutely zero pulling! !!!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy O.

customer_reviews.title: No-Pull Dog Harness
customer_reviews.text: This harness is well made and much thought was put into it's design to help control a large dog. It is easy to put on the dog and adjustments are fairly easy to make. After the adjustments are made it only takes two clasps behind each leg to put the harness on the dog. A determined dog may still be able to chew the harness so the manufacturer has a $12 offer to repair or replace a chewed harness. This harness is designed to be comfortable for the dog also.
customer_reviews.author: rshirley10

customer_reviews.title: Not a miracle harness
customer_reviews.text: After reading about prey-driven animals I bought this harness for our Catahoulas, who lose their minds when we walk local trails (leash trained and good behavior in all other environments). I have used the harness linked to both leaf clips on the harness and in combination with their collars. It did not necessarily provide less pull from the dogs. However, I do sense better control of our male who has a very strong pull. It provides me with the ability to turn him from the front when I need him to return his attention to me.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased over a year ago & it's still awesome. I have an 80+lb , high energy boxer mix who loves the sight of a squirrel or rabbit! He is very strong and became a challenge when walking and he saw a squirrel or critter. A regular harness simply doesn't compare to this! It is a bit tricky to buckle on until you get used to it. Over a year and washed (by hand) several times and no issues with quality. Very comfortable length to walk with, looped handle fits perfectly around my arm when I want to run with him. He still pulls occasionally but I have much better control of him.
customer_reviews.author: k m

customer_reviews.title: Best Harness Ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: This harness is the best harness when it comes to handling high energy dogs. The two point clips, and the top clip on the back of the harness make this a very unique and one of a kind harness. It comes with its own short walking leash; which in itself pays for this harness. This harness also has velvet like straps where they lie against the dogs under arms... making it very soft for them. We have an extremely high maintenance dog - a Hungarian Vizsla, and they are very excitable dogs, so this harness is perfect for him. We love this harness!
customer_reviews.author: A person

customer_reviews.title: Best harness out there!
customer_reviews.text: This harness is easy to work and has a benefit of padding where it goes around the dog's chest (so the harness isn't chaffing if the dog is a puller). I hook both connectors in front; there's an advantage to having several choices of where to hook the leash to the harness and it's an advantage for buckling the dog in the car (whether or not the dog has a coat on). Of all the harness types I've tried, this is far superior to the others. It's expensive, but worth it!
customer_reviews.author: brmsy

customer_reviews.title: Very nice harness
customer_reviews.text: I love having my dogs in a harness instead of a traditional leash and collar. This one is my favorite. Easy to put on and remove from our dogs and easily fitted. I would make one improvement for comfort sake. Where the leash type material connects to the soft plush body portion, under the dog’s chest, there needs to be the plush material covering the attachment point. It’s a niggle but that would make it PERFECT. I recommend
customer_reviews.author: UncleOrly

customer_reviews.title: Best Solution for our Dog!
customer_reviews.text: This harness has worked better than the “pinch” collar, better than the “mini educator”—and several other products we have tried to keep our 60+pound Boxer from pulling. He relaxed as soon as we put the harness on him. We were amazed at how well he did on our first walk, and we continue to be impressed. We have a wonderful well behaved dog now! And he’s very comfortable with the harness. It was easy to put on and adjust too. The harness is light but incredibly strong and the leash that comes with it is well made. The part that goes under him is soft suede.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi 2

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Love the front and back loops to adjust where the leash is connected. It is better than a neck collar on long walks/runs. Color is beautiful and it is of strong construction. My greyhound is very barrel shaped and this adjusted to fit her pretty well. She is skittish and has slipped out of it by pulling her head and legs backwards through the chest strap so I may need one with a second loop around her waist.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Works well, really like using it.
customer_reviews.text: So far I am loving this harness/leash system. We have been using a prong collar for a while and it works, but I always feel bad having to use it. This is a nice alternative to that. We have a boxer/shepherd mix and she still pulls of course but this helps get her back where she needs to be without having something around her neck. We walk to the school stop every morning and I'm still able to help her use her "manners" with the all the kids around. I really like having both the attachment on the back and the front at the same time. I would recommend this leash system to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Oyster

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: I am pretty happy with this. Probably not totally worth the full price but my last harness was hurting my dog so needed a new one ASAP so this is worth it. Only concern is the buckles are sticky and cant tell if they are poor quality like they are going to break or if they are just sticky, other than that I'm happy. My husky is 62 pounds and I got a Large and it fits. Pretty good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strap snapped on day 1 of use
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my dog and it broke after the first use. They include a "warranty" for straps breaking that you have to pay S&H for, but you shouldn't have to replace straps after the first day. Recommend that others avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: William Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Great harness!
customer_reviews.text: I love 2hounds harness! They are so strudy and help me walk my big boxer. I have two of them. I had to order a larger size after a few years only because my dog is a couch potato and got a little bit chuncky. But the original harness is still really good and sturdy even 5 years after buying it. I have machine washed them(not dried) and they still are great. Definitely worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Nola

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t stop pulling
customer_reviews.text: This leash didn’t work for me and my dog. It worked the first week, but then my dog quickly figured out that he can pull just as easily with this leash as he can a regular leash. I feel like many of the positive reviews might from people who submitted a review after using it only once a few times. Sadly, I’m just outside of my return window and this was extremely expensive for leash that doesn’t work for us.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Love this harness
customer_reviews.text: I have three pit bulls 60 plus pounds. I use this harness on two of them for the walks. It definitely helps with the pulling. What I love about it is one of my pit bulls have sensitive skin and the easy walker harness rubs him raw under his arms, this one however does not. It's easy to adjust as well.
customer_reviews.author: kimmy07

customer_reviews.title: Best harness
customer_reviews.text: This is the best harness I have used. Previous harness have left rub marks across my goldens chest. The velvet covering on the girth strap keeps this from happening. The placement of all of the straps allows for full range of motion from walking to running to full on play or swimming. I am pleased to have found this harness.
customer_reviews.author: KLamb

customer_reviews.title: Best Harness on the planet!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: five stars are not enough. the product is the best harness set up I have ever used. In fact this is my second one. My Pup chewed on the first. I called they are repairing it for free ad ordered another one just to have multiple colors. My Golden loves to wear "his shirt". When he puts the harness on to go out and about he walks with a strut. I recommend this product to every dog owner on the planet.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Mays

customer_reviews.title: Our pup easily chewed himself out
customer_reviews.text: We switched out to this harness from the comfort harness bought at our local pet store at the recommendation of our trainer for our greater swiss mountain dog. Apparently, he did not like the feel and was able to pretty easily chew through the front strap within a few minutes of having it on to free himself. I had ordered a second harness that would arrive quicker than the first, so tried again when the second harness arrived but he was able to chew out of that one even quicker. We only attempted to put it on for walking and he is not typically a problem chewer.
customer_reviews.author: M BS

customer_reviews.title: Too tight in 1 area too lose in other
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my Golden Retriever. The under arm piece is tight at its loosest setting. The front part is loose at its tightest setting. Makes no sense. My dog is not overweight or barrel chested. I thought maybe I had it on backwards but is on as shown in picture.
customer_reviews.author: Emtae

customer_reviews.title: Seller May Not be Verified
customer_reviews.text: An advertised "new" product was actually damaged/used(?). Also, before I even opened it the packaging looked like it was hastily put together. With taping around the middle rather than where supplier machines would tape. 2Hounds is a great quality harness, I am suspicious this isn't the verified seller but someone claiming to be them.
customer_reviews.author: IBK

customer_reviews.title: So thankful to find this!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never felt compelled to write a product review before...but after fitting this for my reactive rescue dog, and having a few AMAZING walks with her in it, I am so happy/relived/impressed that I had to review in hopes others will buy and love this product too! She’s a pitt mix so; oddly shaped but also very strong when she pulls. Having no hair on her belly, other harnesses would cut into her and if left loose, allow her to lunge out of them. Not this harness! The velvet belly strap is strong but soft and the two headed lease gives me opportunity to safely guide her away from whatever she is reacting too. Keeps us both calm and safe!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works For Training !
customer_reviews.text: This harness and leash were highly complimented by our dog trainer, as she is training our dog to heel when on this pairing. He is learning to heel very quickly when the leash is entirely hooked on the front clasp. He is a 65 lb Standard Poodle so we need for him to be a gentleman when going for a walk. Using his old harness and leash it was like being behind a sled dog team running a race !
customer_reviews.author: TRS45

customer_reviews.title: Best Harness !
customer_reviews.text: Love It! I was able to walk and control my rescue pit bull with this harness. She is a big dog and it was hard to control her while we went for walks. She would pull hard and try to control me . I am in control and she listen now. THANK YOU!
customer_reviews.author: ms.cruz

customer_reviews.title: Great harness - improvement needed on the leash
customer_reviews.text: I like the harness. It’s the first one I found to fit my dog but the leash I received is a little short and she keeps getting tangled up with it. The leash is the only reason I am giving 4 stars which is a minor issue. I am going to get another harness when I have extra money for my other dog but I think I am just going to buy a coupler and a different leash that should do the same as the leash you have.
customer_reviews.author: Sher

customer_reviews.title: BEST.THING.EVER
customer_reviews.text: Read the reviews about it being a game changer and wasnt seeing it until we attached the leash to just the front of the harness. Completely changed our 2y/o Huskies non stop pulling. He would act as if he was single handedly pulling the sled of the ididerod and the fate of Alaska depended upon him. We tried everything, and nothing worked with him until we discovered this amazing harness and leash. He can no longer lunge or pull as it turns him around quickly. Took 1 walk for our difficult to teach dog to learn to walk with us, not drag us along.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK, but doesn't stop excited dogs every time
customer_reviews.text: Only effective if you use the short dual leash. Even then, my overly friendly young dog will still pull if he gets close to other dogs or people. Nothing seems to stop him from wanting to say Hi. We're working on training. This harness is worth a try, though.
customer_reviews.author: Regular Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It allows better control of the dog without chocking them
customer_reviews.text: cannot say enough about how goof this harness is. It allows better control of the dog without chocking them. It allows you to lead them, using the connector on their chest, and to physically restrain them (if needed) using the connector on the back. Combining the two is a FANTASTIC way to train a dog on just how they should behave when on a leash.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Way to Control the Uncontrollable!
customer_reviews.text: Several good things about this leash and collar. First when properly installed, a gentle tug on the harness will generally keep the dog inline. The second leash attachment on the chest will help "steer" the dog. This arrangement works well in keeping the dog inline. As a recommendation; it needs to be installed somewhat snug tot he dog to be effective. I also liked the seller of this. They were quick to ship, and the product was as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Lipps

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY
customer_reviews.text: I can walk my dog without him yanking my arm out of its socket. I really like that there is two points of control. The point on top closes around the dogs chest as he pulls harder and the point on the chest helps control direction. It makes this harness super versatile. I like to just attach it in the front since he's learned not to pull. I own two of these and both are of great quality. I do wish the leash was a tad longer but it does give me ultimate control. Even if your dog doesn't pull, this would be a great security harness for those that like attempt to escape.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: 110% SATISFIED! Wonderful product!
customer_reviews.text: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! Comfortable velvet strap across his belly keep him from chafing , the front clip and martingale loop on the back is perfect for slowing him down and turning him around if he does pull, but he didn't pull once! I am ABSOLUTELY AMAZED as to the instant and dramatic change in his walking behavior! Mind you I JUST got it in the mail not an hour ago! A MUST BUY for anyone who has a large breed dog with high energy! Trust me when I say you'll be saving yourself a lot of stress and soreness by using this product! You AND your pup will be ALOT happier -- BUY THIS PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa C Scott

customer_reviews.title: Finally found a great no-pull harness!
customer_reviews.text: Got this harness today and took it for a test walk. I absolutely love it! I’m so happy to finally have found a no-pull harness that works really well to stop pulling, AND doesn’t shift when he pulls off to the side! Others didn’t stay in place despite being fitted snug enough. I bought the package that came with the double ended leash, and it worked very well. I’m tempted to buy another one in a different color.
customer_reviews.author: Julie T

customer_reviews.title: Our super, over-hyper pit mix was not going to happy ...
customer_reviews.text: Our super, over-hyper pit mix was not going to happy until he saw one of us in the emergency room. Multiple attempts at leash training him(over the course of two years) were absolute disasters. He was a total spaz on the leash and would choke himself the whole time, all the while trying to drag me into traffic. The MINUTE we got this on him he completely stopped trying to dislocate my shoulder. He turned into a gentleman on his walks. I would have paid my weight in gold for this harness. I recommend spending the extra money for the training leash that comes with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Helps make pulling more controllable
customer_reviews.text: I've had the harness for a week now. I'm a short person and my dog is a big guy, making walks not a pleasant experience. The material is pretty strong and so are the clips. This harness is built in such a way that my dog has not been able to back out and slip it off, thus escaping. It also has helped make my dog's pulling more controllable, however he still manages to pull. The colors are super cute too.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Dogs can easily chew though nylon straps
customer_reviews.text: The design worked beautifully, but if you buy one NEVER leave it on your dog at the end of the walk. Fits perfectly (after proper adjustments) when your dog is standing up, but blouses out in front when they lie down. If you leave your pooch unsupervised for even a few minutes, kiss your investment goodbye.
customer_reviews.author: Jill F.

customer_reviews.title: great and simple tool to control pulling
customer_reviews.text: I have a 72 lb lab mix who gets excited and will pull away from me in sudden bursts of movement. This harness system with the double attaching leash is great. He has enough room to move and sniff, but is controlled to stay in heeling position and not pull away or ahead of me. The harness is easy to put on and take off and there has been no chaffing under his leg or his body.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: This is not a magic wand but it’s high quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is not a magic wand. At lest not for an 8 month German Shepard who loves to pull. You will have to train and be patient. This is a perfect pain free tool to deter pulling. The quality is worth the money as well. Training and progress takes patience and time.
customer_reviews.author: Savanah

customer_reviews.title: Not what we hoped for
customer_reviews.text: The harness fit his gurth but not in other places. We tightened it as much as possible but was still not snug . It was also sewed wrong and had a twist in the harness. Disappointed for how expensive this was. Will be returning item.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Fergus

customer_reviews.title: Slipped right out
customer_reviews.text: I have a female boxer that is 1.5 years old. This harness was no match for her. I tightened to the point of too tight and she still slipped out. I'll stick with the usual training with walking.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Easy control
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, sturdy, adjustable harness that allows for full control of large, muscular dogs. This double contact (front cheat and back shoulders) allow for easy going walks. We are easily able to steer our dog away from unwanted traffic, people, animals or objects.
customer_reviews.author: Mortar and Pestle

customer_reviews.title: Not a good choice for large dogs.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't help with pulling. I feel like my arm will be ripped from the socket while my dog has this harness on. Took him to my pet store to check the fit. Fit correct. Not a good choice for strong dog who are heavy pullers.
customer_reviews.author: Christine B.

customer_reviews.title: Gamechanger!!!
customer_reviews.text: We just got this in but I’ll say I was amazed walking our 65 LB Goldendoodle this afternoon. She hates a leash. Such a good dog but totally uncontrollable on a leash. She typically pulls and chokes while leashed but with this harness there was no such nonsense. We are so excited over this purchase bc we get to enjoy our amazing dog!! Thank you!! We will purchase another once our second pup is full grown!
customer_reviews.author: MAS

customer_reviews.title: Love this harness!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 45lb - 11 month old boxer who (no matter what we tried) kept pulling us everywhere. Since using this harness, she no longer pulls. She also used to jump when people came near, now when you pull on her harness, she knows to sit and wait. I loved this harness so much, I purchased one for our 18lb boston terrier who also pulls (since she is a smaller dog we didn't worry much about the pulling, but since getting this harness for our boxer and noticing a huge difference, we ordered one for our Boston Terrier). Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie Y.

customer_reviews.title: Harness sucks
customer_reviews.text: We haven’t even had this harness for 24 hours. We tried it on my dog, found out it was too big, and he chewed it in 1/2 right away. He has chewed on cheaper leashes and harnesses and they last for months. As a matter of fact, they haven’t broken yet! Other things he’s chewed are pictured.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Reed

customer_reviews.title: A must have! Great harness!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great harness especially if your dog is a puller I volunteer at my local shelter and use it when walking the shelter dogs who are strong pullers give you great control
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This halter collar is miraculous!
customer_reviews.text: My cattle dog mix was a terrible walker on the leash wearing a typical neck collar and wouldn't stop pulling. After being recommended this halter collar, I was hopeful but not convinced. We just received it in the mail today and went for our first walk in it (I never walk him because he always pulls so we bike on/off leash). IT WAS MIRACULOUS! He heeled without me demanding him too, and walked right by my side for the entire 1 mile walk! 10/10 recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Hendrix

customer_reviews.title: Works Fantastic on my Golden Retriever
customer_reviews.text: My golden loves to pull quite a bit toward other dogs. This leash really helps to mitigate the amount of force I feel when he pulls. It has even helped with leash training. Last thought, on a hot summer day, it doesn't make your dog heat up as much as a traditional harness would that covers more of your dog's body.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great harness for any dog!
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriends dog had no issue with me putting it on her. She seems comfortable with it on during her walks, really helps train her to not pull on the leash and walk with you as supposed to leading you. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: villanovavicente

customer_reviews.title: Wont stop dog from pulling if he's strong like mine!
customer_reviews.text: I honestly see no change he pulls me everywhere! I thought this would make training easier but it doesn't. It just looks good!
customer_reviews.author: 2lovemefirst

customer_reviews.title: Really helps make our walks more enjoyable
customer_reviews.text: I love the quality, padded straps, & custom fit, plus the included training leash. Our dog is around 53 pounds of muscle (an American Bulldog mix). Prior to this Freedom No-Pull harness, I had tried 3 other no pulls, including Sporn & Gentle Leader, with no noticeable results, so had been using a prong color as a last resort. I feel much better being able to walk Sam on a loose leash with this harness. He is more relaxed, and I am, too. Will he occasionally pull when he sees a squirrel, etc.--of course, but he is very responsive on this harness. Highly recommend this product for anyone who wants a more relaxed & safe walk with their dog.
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: This really works!
customer_reviews.text: Our active 4 legged friend was not a uncontrollable walker but consistently wanted to get somewhere quicker. The instant we started using the "Freedom" no pull harness we were sold. Our happy friend now walks at our pace not hers! That is all we wanted out of this purchase and are completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Standriff

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad
customer_reviews.text: Despite the way it looks online, it does cut across the shoulders which isn't what I wanted. Fits well and I like the velveteen material on the belly. I love the leash though.
customer_reviews.author: K Fish

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for my strong-willed pup
customer_reviews.text: This harness is the answer to my strong-willed pup's desire to control our daily walks. It works so well, I've begun introducing him to hiking my favorite trails. Previously, that wasn't even a consideration.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for my dog.
customer_reviews.text: This harness did not work for my dog. She is the worst puller and most reactive dog I have ever owned. She just put her weight into it and pulled. It was not more affective than a regular step in harness.
customer_reviews.author: DJF

customer_reviews.title: Best harness on the market! It works and is SAFE and COMFORTABLE for my pup!
customer_reviews.text: This harness does what it says it will. My German shepherd pup always pulls but not since putting him in this harness. Normally, walking with him is an arm work out. This harness has made our walks enjoyable. It is easy and fast to put on and take off. It even comes with a warranty that replaces up to 2 straps should my dog chew through them. I am not worried about chaffing (like with other harnesses) as the strap that goes beneath his arms is covered in velvet. I am completely satisfied with my purchase. We have gone through many other harnesses and THIS IS THE ONE! Best on the market!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Injured my dog and customer service didn't respond!
customer_reviews.text: Did not work for my dog. It rubbed parts of his chest raw, because of stitching. It was correct size and everything. Customer service didn't respond to me either. I ended up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Emily E. Connors

customer_reviews.title: This leashed made a difference on my first try. ...
customer_reviews.text: This leashed made a difference on my first try. I used the side clip (one of serveral methods) and it distracted my dog so much that she stopped pulling. Seems to work by squeezing her chest and pulling her sideways as she pulls forward. And she's a German Shepherd pup. I needed some help to stop her pulling because she's getting to big to control.
customer_reviews.author: Clucking Kj

customer_reviews.title: Order picking not good
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good harness. Design and functionality are great. But it took (3) orders and returns to get a large harness that we ordered. And we still never got the write color. We gave up and settled for the color you finally sent in the large size. Product is wonderful. Picking order department not so much Thank you Jim Z
customer_reviews.author: james zimmermann

customer_reviews.title: Fits good.
customer_reviews.text: Dog still pulls, not quite as hard. Fit and finish is really good. I do like the way it fits.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like a dream
customer_reviews.text: We actually own this in medium and large! Works on our dane and our mix puppy! Stops pulling and the painful arm tugging!!
customer_reviews.author: Allyson

customer_reviews.title: BEST harness ever!
customer_reviews.text: This has got to be the BEST harness I have used ever. My dog is quite the puller and I have tried Martingale collars, pincher collars and other types of harnesses. And she found a way out of them and take off! This has made our walks better and she doesn't try to take it off. I love this one so much, I have another one in a different color.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: FIts my deep chested dog well!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an alternative to the Easy Walk in light of the fact that my 8 month old Weimaraner puppy outgrew the chest straps long before he grew into the rest of the Easy Walk, result being wasted money and a relatively poor fit. Heard about the Freedom Harness from one the treiners at SFSPCA. Very pleased with the Freedom Harness! My pup has lots of room to grown in ALL dimensions (including the chest), and the harness is attractive, sturdy, and overall pretty easy on/off.
customer_reviews.author: SFNP127

customer_reviews.title: Great Harness
customer_reviews.text: Love this harness, recommend it to everyone. Tried plenty of harnesses, and this was the first one that had some give, but the buckles don't slip. Only had to adjust it once in about 8 months of everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great for training
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to train our growing labs while they went out on walks in our city. The design of the harness is good, the velvet prevents chaffing on my dog which was very important. I love that you can use the leash two different ways, one more controlling for training the rowdy dogs we had. Our lab however might just be too stubborn because I did not see much ease in her pulling to the sides. Overall though this eased the stress of our walks and the dogs wag their tales happily as soon as we pull them off the hooks.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly w

customer_reviews.title: 100% Satisfied Customer!
customer_reviews.text: We have a great but rambunctious, 5 month old Golden Retriever that wouldn't stop pulling while on his walks. I received our Freedom Harness this morning and have walked him 3 times since. Although he thought it was a new game to get his harness on each time, he never once pulled on his leash on any of our 3 walks today. I could not be more satisfied with a new product purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Juan Carosso

customer_reviews.title: I definitely recommend this harness and the training lead (the short leash)
customer_reviews.text: I definitely recommend this harness and the training lead (the short leash). As others have pointed out, the harness does not prevent the dog from pulling - that required TRAINING on the owner's part (my deficit) and I will work on that. But I'm using this harness on both of my large bloodhounds and I have confidence that the product (good materials, well constructed) will hold up. It was easy to adjust to my dog's specific body/size/shape and I feel that my dogs are comfortable, yet secure.
customer_reviews.author: S D.

customer_reviews.title: Marginal functionality
customer_reviews.text: It is what is advertised but the functionality in actual use is marginal. After two weeks of use I switched to a standard choker chain (which when used correctly does not choke) and the results were remarkably better from the very start. In hindsight I should have just used the chain from the start.
customer_reviews.author: altos

customer_reviews.title: Good harness, not so good chew replacement warranty
customer_reviews.text: The harness works well in controlling a dog. I like it. And they have a chew guarantee that if chewed they'll replace up to two harnesses. But it is somewhat of a hollow guarantee because you must pay them to use this warranty and pay for shipping to them. So youre paying over $20 to use their warranty. otherwise I'd give move stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! My dog always pulled my girlfriend around whenever she would take him out for a walk. The FIRST time she used this harness, he did not pull her at all. By the third time, he was walking right next to her, not pulling even the slightest. I would highly recommend this harness to anyone that wants their good boys and girls to be better behaved on walks.
customer_reviews.author: Justin S

customer_reviews.title: Only harness worth buying
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best harness Iv ever bought and I tell everyone who has a large dog it’s a must! I have bought several throughout the years for my boxer and my pit and they work amazing my dogs swim and play in them and they really hold up
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leash could be longer. Had to return for smaller size.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered large, but my dog's measurements were 28-28.5". I later saw the note to go to a lower size. I just received the medium. Much better fit, but 5/8" is too thinfor 53 lbs. dog so keeping large returning medium. I wish that the leash was a little longer!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Harrell

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my pitty. When hooked just to the loop vs to the loop and chest huge difference. So easy to adjust to and having such a short lead is great for control
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Rich

customer_reviews.title: Miney well spent.
customer_reviews.text: My Australian shepherd and retriever mix is the only dog I've ever had that has taken ME for a walk. I have gone through three other harnesses before finding this gem. From the moment I put it on him I had immediate control. The duel leash is a necessity and helps steer them. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good harness; Holding up well
customer_reviews.text: My dog does really well on the Freedom Harness. It works but does not overly restrict her movement such that she can still run/jog/jump into the car, while still working on her obedience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SUPER CUTE and WONDERFUL QUALITY HARNESS! Better than expected!!
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable!!! The company was caring & timely in getting this harness to me for a sweet, but large recue dog in desperate need of learning to walk properly on a lead/harness. When it arrived, it was made of AMAZING QUALITY and absolutely beautiful. I cannot say enough about the harness or the design. AWESOME!! And our recued "Ginger" is being walked daily at her rescue thanks the The No-Pull Harness!! (by the way, it came highly recommended, too). THANKYOU!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Frances

customer_reviews.title: Great harness
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for a friend. New harness arrived in teal. Plenty of adjustments to fit. Very pleased, would buy this again. Extra control with two D-ring clip system.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah M James

customer_reviews.title: My dog enjoys walks and this harness make it enjoyable for me.
customer_reviews.text: The dog harness helps to stop my dog from pulling during walks. This is the next size up as my dog grew. The harness is well made and adjusts easily. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Best harness so far
customer_reviews.text: There is life on Earth! This harness is a game-changer.
customer_reviews.author: Augusto Cesar De Moraes

customer_reviews.title: Good durable design and great for a strong dog.
customer_reviews.text: Bought by my son for his good, which is very strong and loves to pull. This is pretty easy to put on. It mercifully distributes the force she applies across a wide area.
customer_reviews.author: White Eagle 60

customer_reviews.title: Perfect No-Pull Harness
customer_reviews.text: Love the no-pull harness. Prevents my dog from chocking. Recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: tskywalker

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I was using pinch collars for my dogs and switched to the Freedom No-Pull Harness. My dogs seem to enjoy their walks much more and they respond to the harness. I am walking 3 dogs at a time (40 lb, 50 lb and 70lb Labs) so if they see a squirrel, it is a little harder to contain them with just the clip on the back. I think it would be fine if I had both the front and back clips attached. I would recommend this harness!
customer_reviews.author: Laura L

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a pit/ Great Dane mix. Bella is 14 months old and weighs near 90lbs. I’ve tried everything from chokers to electronic collars with no success stopping her from pulling. I tried your no- pull harness today and it worked like a charm! Kudos to you all !!! Bella responded to the slightest tug on the harness. Well done 2 Hounds!
customer_reviews.author: frank lucerna

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Control At Last!
customer_reviews.text: This harness seems to be very comfortable for my Pit Bull-Lab mix. It is not a magic bullet against pulling if she sees a squirrel or another dog that needs greeting. But it does give me a lot more control than the vet recommended Gentle Leader Headcollar was giving me before. I will continue to train her to walk without pulling, but at least now people don't ask "Who's walking who?"
customer_reviews.author: Jacey St. Louis

customer_reviews.title: Didn't help with our dog's pulling
customer_reviews.text: Our trainer recommended using this as an alternative to the Halti. The material seems to be good, but ultimately it didn't help with our 60 pound pup's pulling issue and we have stopped using it as a result.
customer_reviews.author: Syd C

customer_reviews.title: An immediate difference
customer_reviews.text: This product is wonderful. I have have two strong dogs. My female I have had since she was a puppy but my male I adopted when he was 9 months. He had never been on a leash and he had this harness when I got him. It works wonders. I can walk him with no problem. I got one for my female and while she didn't need a harness she too walks better with it on. Immediate difference. Clip it in the front for control when walking and on the back to keep them from lunging or jumping. Great product!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chlngrgrl

customer_reviews.title: As with any training device, you must work with ...
customer_reviews.text: As with any training device, you must work with your dog to teach them not to pull. However, this harness is very effective at helping to control an unruly dog while you work on training to solve the issue.
customer_reviews.author: SBaker

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, simple harness for hot climates
customer_reviews.text: This works great for my dog -- other harnesses were too heavy, especially given Texas summers. Has held up very well over time.
customer_reviews.author: FA in Austin

customer_reviews.title: Quality but didn’t work for our strong dog.
customer_reviews.text: Turned my dog into a sled dog. A Halti works much better for our 75 lb bouvier.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Great harness!
customer_reviews.text: This harness helped a lot with keeping my boxer from pulling while going to training classes. Fits pretty true to size, I have a 75 lb boxer and I got a large. Love the fact that this harness also had the leash with it so I could hook to the front and back. Great way to keep control of my boxer.
customer_reviews.author: April Wilson

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: This has ABSOLUTELY helped me be able to walk one of my dogs myself! He is a big time puller and although he still pulls with this, I can brace myself better and it tires him out faster.
customer_reviews.author: CaseyK

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a while
customer_reviews.text: The harness and double leash kept my border collie from pulling for about a week, now he has begun to ignore it like all other "no-pull" devices I've tried. Apparently he needs a different type of training. Also, the first time I put the harness on him he nearly bit through the chest strap in less than a minute when I wasn't watching him; I had to have it repaired before I could take him out with it. The webbing is strong but it could be a little thicker for large dogs with big teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for my "I'm a Husky trapped in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work for my "I'm a Husky trapped in the body of an Australian Shepherd" puller. He still pulled just as badly with this harness as he did with others. Was not worth the cost. Only upside is I can use it on my other dog(she's about the same size or I couldn't) who does not pull if the new harness I bought for the puller does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for reactive dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I have a very reactive doberman and that leash and harness are wonderful. But if he wears the harness too long it he gets chafed under leg pits.
customer_reviews.author: M. Green

customer_reviews.title: Good harness. I like that it connects at 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: Good harness. I like that it connects at 2 points, better at turning the dog away from squirrels. The leash isn't too long, which is nice at staying close than having the dog run to the end and yank my arm too hard.
customer_reviews.author: jmumv

customer_reviews.title: Better than prong collars, choke chains, and other harnesses!
customer_reviews.text: I have two very determined pullers. These harnesses are making it much easier to get their attention. The harnesses don't stop dogs from pulling, but by attaching the leash at the chest and back, you can redirect the dog so it's looking at you rather than pulling away from you. I brought lots of treats, took the dogs out one at a time to get all of us used to things, and had fun for a change!
customer_reviews.author: rescue mom

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: Took a few minutes to figure out how to hook my dog up so we're both comfy but I did and it's pretty easy to use! Could be a little wider in larger sizes for big dogs and the main thing it's missing is a metal ring apparatus for the leash hookups. I have a rescue dog who is in training and he is big puller-and has pulled through this kind of webbing so hope the two leash hookups help....
customer_reviews.author: CindyRVA

product_meta.title: 2 Hounds Design Freedom No-Pull Dog Harness with Leash, Large
feature_bullets: Recommended by Whole Dog Journal, the VIN (Veterinary Information Network) and many dog trainers as the ultimate in flexibility, control, and training.

Stop the pulling!: Attaching your leash to the martingale loop on the back will allow your dog to walk in a straight line without twisting or straining, while also discouraging pulling by gently tightening around the chest. Attaching your leash to the ring on the front of the chest lets you “steer” your dog. Using a double-ended leash allows you to connect to the front and back of the harness simultaneously for even more control.

Comfortable and durable: The Freedom no-pull harness has a soft velvet lining on the strap that goes behind the legs to prevent sores that sometimes occur with harnesses. This well made harness will stand up to daily use by even the strongest dogs!

Chew warranty: The manufacturer will replace up to two chewed straps for just the cost of shipping. Contact us for instructions if your harness needs to be repaired. Please note that it is best to not leave the harness on your dog while unattended as chewing can happen FAST!

Perfect for all dogs: Great control, four points of adjustability and maximum comfort and safety make the Freedom harness perfect for puppies as well as adult and senior dogs of all breeds. It is also great for dogs with amputations, arthritis or other injuries.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
